Articles.Content: Hello All.  I have seen threads mentioning the Kerbnet and how it detects anomalies.  I have a rover with a rovermate probe body and I have seen where this should allow me to use the Kerbnet.  Is this a mod?  If not how do I access it?
Kerbnet is stock. You right click a probe core and it should have a Kerbnet access button.
Ok...Then I think I have a problem.  I right click my Rovemate and the only options are control from here or rename vessel.  Any thoughts?

1 hour ago, Ncog Nito said:

Ok...Then I think I have a problem.  I right click my Rovemate and the only options are control from here or rename vessel.  Any thoughts?

I believe that your probe ran out of electricity try adding solar panels and a battery 

 

safe travels

 

hugo
No that's not it either.  I have 10 solar panels on my rover and 3, 1000 point batteries and I am fully charged.
How about a screenshot of the vessel? And one with your r-click menu open for the Rovemate?
What version of KSP are you running?

5 hours ago, Foxster said:

What version of KSP are you running?

V 1.0.4.861...

 

9 hours ago, Vanamonde said:

How about a screenshot of the vessel? And one with your r-click menu open for the Rovemate? 

And, I cannot seem to get my screenshot to work...hit F1 and nothing.
I don't think you are going to find KerbNet in that version of KSP.
Ok...I figured out where my screenshots are at...now how do I post it?  And, where can I find updates?  Please and thank you.
Depends where you bought KSP from. Steam?

3 hours ago, Ncog Nito said:

V 1.0.4.861...

 

And, I cannot seem to get my screenshot to work...hit F1 and nothing.

Just to make this more explicit - you're running version 1.0.4.  1.1 was a major update in April 2016, 1.2 was a major update in October 2016.  There have been a couple smaller bugfix/updates since - the current version is 1.2.2.  The Kerbnet feature was part of the 1.2 update and didn't exist before that.

Any version purchased from any of the legal vendors is entitled to free updates to the current 1.2.  If you got yours through some other method - well, everyone here would like to see Squad continue to provide updates to this game, and game developer salaries are paid by buying games.  So you know what you should do in that case.
You can upload screenmshots to an image hosting site such as Imgur.com, and copy the BBCode link they provide into your posts.
